question_sentence: Which country recently experienced a devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake?
evidence: At least 2,205 people were killed and more than 3,600 were injured when the temblor struck Afghanistan.

question_sentence: The US conducted a deadly military strike this week on a boat in the Caribbean that was allegedly carrying members of which drug cartel?
evidence: The use of military force against the Latin American drug cartel Tren de Aragua marks a significant escalation in the US war on drugs.

question_sentence: Which country staged a massive military parade this week as it seeks to tilt the global balance of power?
evidence: While each country is determined to push back against Western rules, China has spent this week promoting itself as “a credible alternative” to the US as the world’s top superpower.

question_sentence: Which of the following people is slated to receive the Presidential Medal of Freedom?
evidence: President Trump announced this week that he plans to award the highest civilian honor to Rudy Giuliani, his former personal attorney.

question_sentence: More than 1,000 current and former employees of the Department of Health and Human Services signed an open letter calling for which of the following?
choices: The restoration of diversity, equity and inclusion policies
A ban on the sale of processed foods
The resignation of Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
evidence: The HHS employees claim in the letter that Kennedy’s leadership has “put the health of all Americans at risk,” and they want him to step down.

question_sentence: Which company ousted its CEO this week over a code of conduct violation?
evidence: Just one year after he took the helm, Laurent Freixe was dismissed from Nestlé for failing to disclose a romantic relationship with a subordinate.

question_sentence: What had been the world’s largest iceberg is rapidly breaking up, scientists say. How big is it now?
choices: About the size of Greater London
As big as the iceberg Buddy rode from the North Pole
evidence: The “megaberg” previously spanned an area of 1,418 square miles, but now it’s shrunk to about 656 square miles — which equates to roughly the size of Greater London.

question_sentence: Why did Shein take down the listing for a shirt this week?
choices: It featured an edited image of an accused killer
It was made of highly flammable material
evidence: The fast fashion giant said it was conducting an investigation after a product on its website included an edited image of Luigi Mangione, the man accused of killing UnitedHealthcare’s CEO last year.

question_sentence: Actress Amanda Seyfried was so enamored with this Oscar winner’s outfit at the Venice Film Festival that she asked to borrow it. Which woman wore it first?
evidence: Julia Roberts and Amanda Seyfried came to the festival to promote their films, “After the Hunt” and “The Testament of Ann Lee,” respectively. But they ended up reliving the plot of “The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants.”

question_sentence: Thousands of people gathered in the Netherlands recently to celebrate which of the following?
evidence: The Redhead Days Festival included music, food trucks and workshops tailored to the particular needs of redheads, including make-up explainers and skin cancer prevention.
